channel.title: Turkey on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in Turkey on FinanClub

item.title: Banks Divided Over Size of Turkey Rate Hikes After Erdogan's Win
item.description: Banks Divided Over Size of Turkey Rate Hikes After Erdogan’s Win Turkish banks are divided over the size of rate hikes that the central bank will need to implement after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s re-election victory. Some banks believe that the central bank will need to raise rates by 500 basis points or more in order to curb inflation, which is currently running at 70%.

item.title: Why Turkey's President Faces the Biggest Election Challenge in Years
item.description: Turkey’s Presidential Election: Erdogan Faces His Biggest Challenge in Years Incumbent Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan faces his biggest challenge in 20 years in Sunday’s runoff election against opposition candidate Kemal Kilicdaroglu. WSJ’s Jared Malsin explains why this is one of the world’s most important votes.
